numericDates.label: Numeric Dates
numericDates.tooltip: You can optionally choose to receive and send dates/times in numeric format, as milliseconds since the UNIX epoch (midnight on January 1, 1970 in UTC time), using the query string parameter numericDates with a value of true. This query parameter works for any API request.

Content-Type.label: Content Type
Content-Type.tooltip: Required for POST and PUT requests. Defines the structure for the request body.

schema.description: Array of BulkItemFailure objects which represents the items that failed to be added or updated. See [Partial Success](/partial-success) for more information. Applicable only for bulk operations that support partial success.

rowId.description: The Id of the row that failed. Applicable only to bulk row operations.

error.description: The error caused by the failed item.

refId.description: The Id of the specific error occurrence. Please include this information when contacting Smartsheet support.

errorCode.description: Custom error code from Smartsheet. See the complete [Error Code List](../#section/Error-Code-List).

index.description: The index of the failed item in the bulk request array.

contents.description: The type of widget content depends on the value of widget.type.

reportId.description: Report Id denoting container source, if applicable.

sheetId.description: Sheet Id denoting container source, if applicable.

axisTitleFont.description: List of supported fonts in Dashboards

axisLabelFont.description: List of supported fonts in Dashboards

interactionType.description:
Specifies what happens when a user clicks the widget. The type will determine what other properties are needed.
 * DISTI_COPY - a distribution link, only available if org has distribution
links enabled.
 * NONE - do nothing, no other attribute required.
 * SMARTSHEET_ITEM - open a Smartsheet item that is not the SOURCE_SHEET,
must also have one of the following attributes:
    * dashboardId
    * folderId
    * reportId
    * sheetId
    * workspaceId
 * SOURCE_SHEET - open the container where the widget data comes from,
no other attribute required.
 * WEB -  launch the URL, must also have url attribute.

folderId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the folder to open.

reportId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the report to open.

sheetId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the sheet to open.

sightId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the dashboard to open.

url.description: If interactionType = WEB this is the URL to launch.

workspaceId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the workspace to open.

includedColumnIds.description: Array of column Ids if the range was selected through the UI.

legendFormat.description: The format descriptor (see [Formatting](/section/Formatting)). Only returned if the legend has a non-default format applied to it.

legendFont.description: List of supported fonts in Dashboards

items.description: Defines a block of cells in a sheet.

sourceColumnId1.description: Defines beginning edge of range when specifying one or more columns.

sourceColumnId2.description: Defines ending edge of range when specifying one or more columns.

sourceRowId1.description: Defines beginning edge of range when specifying one or more rows.

sourceRowId2.description: Defines ending edge of range when specifying one or more rows.

xFormat.description: The format descriptor (see [Formatting](/section/Formatting)). Only returned if the series has a non-default format applied to it.

yFormat.description: The format descriptor (see [Formatting](/section/Formatting)). Only returned if the series has a non-default format applied to it.

xFormat.description: The format descriptor (see [Formatting](/section/Formatting)). Only returned if the series has a non-default format applied to it.

yFormat.description: The format descriptor (see [Formatting](/section/Formatting)). Only returned if the series has a non-default format applied to it.

items.description: Defines a block of cells in a sheet.

sourceColumnId1.description: Defines beginning edge of range when specifying one or more columns.

sourceColumnId2.description: Defines ending edge of range when specifying one or more columns.

sourceRowId1.description: Defines beginning edge of range when specifying one or more rows.

sourceRowId2.description: Defines ending edge of range when specifying one or more rows.

sheetId.description: Sheet Id from which the cell data originates.

objectValue.description: The type of data returned depends on the cell type and the data in the cell.

columnId.description: The Id of the column that the cell is located in.

columnType.description: Only returned if the include query string parameter contains **columnType**.

conditionalFormat.description: The format descriptor describing this cell's conditional format. Only returned if the include query string parameter contains **format** and this cell has a conditional format applied.

displayValue.description: Visual representation of cell contents, as presented to the user in the UI.

format.description: The format descriptor. Only returned if the include query string parameter contains **format** and this cell has a non-default format applied.

formula.description: The formula for a cell, if set, for instance **=COUNTM([Assigned To]3)**. Note that calculation errors or problems with a formula do not cause the API call to return an error code. Instead, the response contains the same value as in the UI, such as **cell.value = "#CIRCULAR REFERENCE"**.

reportId.description: If non-null, this hyperlink is a link to the report with this Id.

sheetId.description: If non-null, this hyperlink is a link to the sheet with this Id.

sightId.description: If non-null, this hyperlink is a link to the dashboard with this Id.

url.description: When the hyperlink is a URL link, this property contains the URL value. When the hyperlink is a dashboard/report/sheet link (that is, dashboardId, reportId, or sheetId is non-null), this property contains the permalink to the dashboard, report, or sheet.

height.description: Original height (in pixels) of the uploaded image.

width.description: Original width (in pixels) of the uploaded image.

columnId.description: Column Id of the linked cell.

rowId.description: Row Id of the linked cell.

sheetId.description: Sheet Id of the sheet that the linked cell belongs to.

sheetName.description: Sheet name of the linked cell.

status.description:
* `BLOCKED` One of several other values indicating unusual error conditions.
* `BROKEN` The row or sheet linked to was deleted.
* `CIRCULAR` One of several other values indicating unusual error conditions.
* `DISABLED` One of several other values indicating unusual error conditions.
* `INACCESSIBLE` The sheet linked to cannot be viewed by this user.
* `INVALID` One of several other values indicating unusual error conditions.
* `NOT_SHARED` One of several other values indicating unusual error conditions.
* `OK` The link is in a good state.

columnId.description: Column Id of the linked cell.

rowId.description: Row Id of the linked cell.

sheetId.description: Sheet Id of the sheet that the linked cell belongs to.

sheetName.description: Sheet name of the linked cell.

status.description:
* `BLOCKED` One of several other values indicating unusual error conditions.
* `BROKEN` The row or sheet linked to was deleted.
* `CIRCULAR` One of several other values indicating unusual error conditions.
* `DISABLED` One of several other values indicating unusual error conditions.
* `INACCESSIBLE` The sheet linked to cannot be viewed by this user.
* `INVALID` One of several other values indicating unusual error conditions.
* `NOT_SHARED` One of several other values indicating unusual error conditions.
* `OK` The link is in a good state.

objectValue.description: The base object for values found in the **Cell.objectValue** attribute. Its **objectType** attribute indicates the type of the object. This object itself is not used directly.

overrideValidation.description: (Admin only) Indicates whether the cell value can contain a value outside of the validation limits (value = **true**). When using this parameter, you must also set **strict** to **false** to bypass value type checking. This property is honored for POST or PUT actions that update rows.

strict.description: Set to **false** to enable lenient parsing. Defaults to **true**. You can specify this attribute in a request, but it is never present in a response.

value.description: A string, number, or a Boolean value -- depending on the cell type and the data in the cell. Cell values larger than 4000 characters are silently truncated. An empty cell returns no value.

inheritCellValue.description: Specifies if valueFormat is inherited from the underlying cell value

label.description: Label for the data point. This is either the column name or a user-provided string.

labelFont.description: List of supported fonts in Dashboards

order.description: The display order for the CellDataItem.

contactOptions.description: Array of ContactOption objects to specify a pre-defined list of values for the column. Column type must be CONTACT_LIST.

name.description: Can be a user's name, display name, or free text.

createdBy.description: User object containing name and email of the creator of this summary field.

displayValue.description: Visual representation of cell contents, as presented to the user in the UI.

format.description: The format descriptor. Only returned if the include query string parameter contains format and this column has a non-default format applied to it.

formula.description: The formula for a cell, if set.

reportId.description: If non-null, this hyperlink is a link to the report with this Id.

sheetId.description: If non-null, this hyperlink is a link to the sheet with this Id.

sightId.description: If non-null, this hyperlink is a link to the dashboard with this Id.

url.description: When the hyperlink is a URL link, this property contains the URL value. When the hyperlink is a dashboard/report/sheet link (that is, dashboardId, reportId, or sheetId is non-null), this property contains the permalink to the dashboard, report, or sheet.

height.description: Original height (in pixels) of the uploaded image.

width.description: Original width (in pixels) of the uploaded image.

index.description: Field index or position. This number is zero-based.

locked.description: Indicates whether the field is locked.

lockedForUser.description: Indicates whether the field is locked for the requesting user.

modifiedBy.description: User object containing name and email of the user who most recently modified this summary field.

objectValue.description: The base object for values found in the **Cell.objectValue** attribute. Its **objectType** attribute indicates the type of the object. This object itself is not used directly.

options.description: When applicable for PICKLIST column type. Array of the options available for the field.

symbol.description: When applicable for PICKLIST column type.

title.description: Arbitrary name, must be unique within summary.

validation.description: Indicates whether summary field values are restricted to the type.

valueFont.description: List of supported fonts in Dashboards

autoNumberFormat.description: Object that describes how the the System Column type of "AUTO_NUMBER" is auto-generated.

fill.description: Indicates zero-padding. Must be between 0 and 10 "0" (zero) characters.

startingNumber.description: The starting number for the auto-id.

contactOptions.description: Array of ContactOption objects to specify a pre-defined list of values for the column. Column **type** must be **CONTACT_LIST**.

name.description: Can be a user's name, display name, or free text.

format.description: The format descriptor (see [Formatting](../../#section/API-Basics/Formatting)). Only returned if the **include** query string parameter contains **format** and this column has a non-default format applied to it.

formula.description: The formula for the column, if set.

hidden.description: Indicates whether the column is hidden.

index.description: Column index or position. This number is zero-based.

locked.description: Indicates whether the column is locked. In a response, a value of **true** indicates that the column has been locked by the sheet owner or the admin.

lockedForUser.description: Indicates whether the column is locked for the requesting user. This attribute may be present in a response, but cannot be specified in a request.

options.description: Array of the options available for the column.

primary.description: Returned only if the column is the Primary Column (value = **true**).

symbol.description: When applicable for **CHECKBOX** or **PICKLIST** column types. See [Symbol Columns](../../tag/columnsRelated#section/Column-Types/Symbol-Columns).

tags.description: Set of tags to indicate special columns. Each element in the array is set to one of the listed enum values.

validation.description: Indicates whether validation has been enabled for the column (value = **true**).

version.description:
* `0`: CONTACT_LIST, PICKLIST, or TEXT_NUMBER.
* `1`: MULTI_CONTACT_LIST.
* `2`: MULTI_PICKLIST.

width.description: Display width of the column in pixels.

interactionType.description:
Specifies what happens when a user clicks the widget. The type will determine what other properties are needed.
 * DISTI_COPY - a distribution link, only available if org has distribution
links enabled.
 * NONE - do nothing, no other attribute required.
 * SMARTSHEET_ITEM - open a Smartsheet item that is not the SOURCE_SHEET,
must also have one of the following attributes:
    * dashboardId
    * folderId
    * reportId
    * sheetId
    * workspaceId
 * SOURCE_SHEET - open the container where the widget data comes from,
no other attribute required.
 * WEB -  launch the URL, must also have url attribute.

folderId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the folder to open.

reportId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the report to open.

sheetId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the sheet to open.

sightId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the dashboard to open.

url.description: If interactionType = WEB this is the URL to launch.

workspaceId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the workspace to open.

fit.description:
Describes how the image occupies the available space of its widget.
 * ACTUAL_SIZE - Uses the original image width and height dimensions.
 * FILL - Scales the image to maintain its aspect ratio while filling
its entire widget. If the image aspect  ratio does not match the aspect ratio of its widget, then the image will be clipped to fit.
 * FIT - Scales the image to maintain its aspect ratio while fitting
within its widget. The image will be  "letterboxed" if its aspect ratio does not match the aspect ratio of its widget. Default value for new  image widgets and for existing image widgets where this property has not been explicitly set.

format.description: Format descriptor. Follows the pattern in FormatTables.

interactionType.description:
Specifies what happens when a user clicks the widget. The type will determine what other properties are needed.
 * DISTI_COPY - a distribution link, only available if org has distribution
links enabled.
 * NONE - do nothing, no other attribute required.
 * SMARTSHEET_ITEM - open a Smartsheet item that is not the SOURCE_SHEET,
must also have one of the following attributes:
    * dashboardId
    * folderId
    * reportId
    * sheetId
    * workspaceId
 * SOURCE_SHEET - open the container where the widget data comes from,
no other attribute required.
 * WEB -  launch the URL, must also have url attribute.

folderId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the folder to open.

reportId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the report to open.

sheetId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the sheet to open.

sightId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the dashboard to open.

url.description: If interactionType = WEB this is the URL to launch.

workspaceId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the workspace to open.

margin.description:
Indicates whether there is margin between the image and its widget borders.
 * MARGIN - Default value for existing image widgets where this
property has not been explicitly set.
 * NO_MARGIN - Default value for new image widgets.

width.description: Original width of the image in pixels.

interactionType.description:
Specifies what happens when a user clicks the widget. The type will determine what other properties are needed.
 * DISTI_COPY - a distribution link, only available if org has distribution
links enabled.
 * NONE - do nothing, no other attribute required.
 * SMARTSHEET_ITEM - open a Smartsheet item that is not the SOURCE_SHEET,
must also have one of the following attributes:
    * dashboardId
    * folderId
    * reportId
    * sheetId
    * workspaceId
 * SOURCE_SHEET - open the container where the widget data comes from,
no other attribute required.
 * WEB -  launch the URL, must also have url attribute.

folderId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the folder to open.

reportId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the report to open.

sheetId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the sheet to open.

sightId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the dashboard to open.

url.description: If interactionType = WEB this is the URL to launch.

workspaceId.description: If interactionType = SMARTSHEET_ITEM this is the workspace to open.

htmlContent.description:
The widget contents as HTML. The Rich Text widget supports the following subset of HTML tags and CSS Styles:

HTML
  * a - hyperlink
  * br - line break
  * li - list item
  * ol - ordered list
  * p - paragraph
  * span - section of the document
  * ul - unordered list

CSS
  * color
  * font-family
  * font-size
  * font-style
  * font-weight
  * text-align
  * text-decoration

reportId.description: If non-null, this hyperlink is a link to the report with this Id.

sheetId.description: If non-null, this hyperlink is a link to the sheet with this Id.

sightId.description: If non-null, this hyperlink is a link to the dashboard with this Id.

url.description: When the hyperlink is a URL link, this property contains the URL value. When the hyperlink is a dashboard/report/sheet link (that is, dashboardId, reportId, or sheetId is non-null), this property contains the permalink to the dashboard, report, or sheet.

labelFont.description: List of supported fonts in Dashboards

order.description: The display order for the ShortcutWidgetItem object.

htmlContent.description:
The widget contents as HTML. The Title widget supports the following subset of HTML tags and CSS Styles:

HTML
  * br - line break
  * p - paragraph
  * span - section of the document

CSS
  * color
  * font-family
  * font-size
  * font-style
  * font-weight
  * text-align
  * text-decoration

url.description: The URL for the web content.

height.description: Number of rows that the widget occupies on the dashboard.

showTitle.description: True indicates that the client should display the widget title. This is independent of the title string which may be null or empty.

showTitleIcon.description: True indicates that the client should display the sheet icon in the widget title.

titleFont.description: List of supported fonts in Dashboards

viewMode.description:
Indicates the content layout. Must use a query parameter of level=2 to see this information.
 * 1 - centered
 * 2 - left aligned

width.description: Number of columns that the widget occupies on the dashboard.

xPosition.description: X-coordinate of widget's position on the dashboard.

yPosition.description: Y-coordinate of widget's position on the dashboard.
